tit.e: Kyoto Hosei Gakko (Kyoto School of Law and Politics）
tit.cmt: 京都法政学校：定訳不明
tit.e: Kyoto Hosei Gakko (Kyoto School of Law and Politics）
Kyoto Hosei Gakko (Kyoto School of Law and Politics）

sen.j: 京都法政学校（きょうとほうせいがっこう）は、1900年に中川小十郎らによって創設された私立学校で、現在の立命館大学（学校法人本部：京都市中京区）の前身。
sen.e: Kyoto Hosei School is private school which established in 1990 by Kojuro NAKAGAWA, the former school of Ritsumeikan University (head office of educational foundation: Nakagyo-ku, Kyoto City)
Kyoto Hosei School is a private school established in 1990 by Kojuro NAKAGAWA, from the former school of Ritsumeikan University (Head Office of the Educational Foundation: Nakagyo-ku, Kyoto City).

Kyoto Hosei School, a private institution established in 1990 by Kojuro NAKAGAWA, et. al, was formerly the school of Ritsumeikan University (head office of the Educational Foundation: Nakagyo-ku, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: et. al 追加 など

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Outline
Outline
Summary

sen.j: 京都法政学校設立の構想と経緯
sen.e: Plan and situation of establishment of Kyoto Hosei School
Plan and situation of Kyoto Hosei School's establishment
Plan and situation of Kyoto Hosei School's establishment

sen.j: 以来西園寺に仕えていた丹波の郷士中川家に生まれた。
sen.e: Born in hometown Tango at Nakagawa family who was working for SAIONJI after that.
He was born into the Nakagawa family in the hometown of Tango, and eventually he went to work for SAIONJI.
He was born into the Nakagawa family in the town of Tanba, and eventually he went to work for SAIONJI.

sen.j: 叔父で東京女子高等師範学校校長を務めた中川謙二郎の勧めで13歳の時に上京。
sen.e: When he was thirteen years old, uncle Kenjiro NAKAGAWA who was the principal of Women's Higher Normal School recommended moving to Tokyo.
When he was 13 years old, his uncle Kenjiro NAKAGAWA, who was the principal of Women's Higher Normal School, recommended that he move to Tokyo.
When he was 13 years old, his uncle Kenjiro NAKAGAWA, who was the principal of Women's Higher Normal School, recommended that he move to Tokyo.

sen.j: 以来、公望の書生として西園寺家に出入りするようになる。
sen.e: After that, visited SAIONJI （Kinmochi)'s house as a student of Kinmochi.
After that, he visited SAIONJI (Kinmochi)'s house as a student of Kinmochi.
After that, he would frequently visit SAIONJI (Kinmochi)'s house as a student of Kinmochi.
sen.cmt: 「出入りする」は、一回だけの訪問ではないと思われるので、oftenを加えました。

sen.j: 西園寺の取り立てで貴族院議員として活躍する一方、西園寺の意思を引き継いで発展した立命館大学の運営にも尽力。
sen.e: Worked as a politician of Kizokuin (House of Peers) by recommendation from SAIONJI （Kinmochi), and also succeeded to SAIONJI （Kinmochi)'s passion which was managing and growth of Ritumeikan University.

He worked as a politician in the Kizokuin (House of Peers) by recommendation from SAIONJI （Kinmochi), and inherited SAIONJI （Kinmochi)'s passion, which was to ensure the management and growth of Ritsumeikan University.

He served as a politician in the Kizokuin (House of Peers) on the recommendation of SAIONJI (Kinmochi), and inherited SAIONJI's passion, which was to ensure the management and growth of Ritsumeikan University.
sen.cmt: 文法、句読点、など数箇所を訂正。

sen.j: 中川は西園寺の薨去まで側近として仕えた。
sen.e: Nakagawa worked for SAIONJI （Kinmochi) as his aide until his death.
Nakagawa worked for SAIONJI （Kinmochi) as his aide until his death.
Nakagawa worked for SAIONJI （Kinmochi) as his aide until his death.

sen.j: 1894年、文部大臣に就任した西園寺公望が「高等教育の拡張計画」を立案。
sen.e: Worked as a politician of House of Lords by recommendation from SAIONJI, and also succeeded to SAIONJI 's passion which was managing and growth of Ritumeikan University.
He worked as a politician in the House of Lords by recommendation from SAIONJI, and succeeded in SAIONJI 's passion, which was to ensure the management and growth of Ritsumeikan University.
IN 1894, Kinmochi SAIONJI assumed the post of Minister of Education and drew up the 'Expansion Plan for Higher Education.'

sen.j: 第一項に、東京帝国大学と相呼応して国家の需要に応じられる高等教育機関を京都にも設置することの必要性を挙げた。
sen.e: At first, he mentioned to establish high education organization in Kyoto that is same level as Tokyo Imperial University which able to work for nation's demands.
His initial goal was to establish an institution for higher education in Kyoto on the same level as Tokyo Imperial University and thereby meet the demands of the nation.
His initial goal was to establish an institution for higher education in Kyoto on the same level as Tokyo Imperial University and thereby meet the demands of the nation.

sen.j: これに基づいて省内に設置した京都帝国大学「創立準備委員」が1897年「京都帝国大学ニ関スル件」（大学設置令）を公布し、京大創設の流れが固まった。
sen.e: Based on that, Kyoto Imperial University 'arrangements committee of establishment', which located in inside of ministry promulgated 'Regarding Kyoto Imperial University' (University establishment ordinance) in 1897, that made the opportunity to establish Kyoto University.

Accordingly, Kyoto Imperial University's 'arrangements committee of establishment,' which was located within the ministry, promulgated 'Regarding Kyoto Imperial University' (University Establishment Ordinance) in 1897, which provided the opportunity to establish Kyoto University.

Accordingly, Kyoto Imperial University's 'arrangements committee of establishment,' which was located within the ministry, promulgated 'Regarding Kyoto Imperial University' (University Establishment Ordinance) in 1897, which provided the opportunity to establish Kyoto University.

sen.j: 当時、文部省専門学務局勤務から文部大臣秘書官として西園寺文部大臣直属となった中川小十郎が、京都帝国大学初代事務局長に任命され大学業務を総括。
sen.e: At that time, Kojurou NAKAGAWA who used work at Specialized academic affairs bureau of Ministry of Education became the secretary of SAIONJI who was minister of education.
At the time, Kojurou NAKAGAWA, who had worked in the specialized Academic Affairs Bureau of the Ministry of Education, became the secretary to SAIONJI, who was the Minister of Education.

At that time, Kojuro NAKAGAWA, who had worked in the specialized Academic Affairs Bureau of the Ministry of Education, became the secretary to SAIONJI, who was the Minister of Education. Subsequently, NAKAGAWA was appointed as the first secretary general of Kyoto Imperial University in charge of school administration.
sen.cmt: 「京都帝国大学初代事務局長に任命され大学業務を総括」の部分の訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 京都帝国大学初代総長に就任した木下廣次らとともに、大学創設の中心的役割を担うことになった。
sen.e: Took the lead for establishment university with Hiroji KINOSHITA who assumed the first president of Kyoto Imperial University.
He took the lead in establishing the university with Hiroji KINOSHITA, who assumed the post as first president of Kyoto Imperial University.
He took the lead in establishing the university with Hiroji KINOSHITA, who assumed the post as first president of Kyoto Imperial University.

sen.j: 京都帝国大学創設事業に区切りがついた1898年、中川小十郎は文部省参事官の職を辞し実業界へと転身。
sen.e: In 1898, when the project of establishment of Kyoto Imperial University was settled, Kojuro NAKAGAWA resigned the counselor of ministry of education and became a business person.
In 1898, when the work of establishing Kyoto Imperial University was settled, Kojuro NAKAGAWA resigned from his post as a counselor to the Ministry of Education and became a businessman.
In 1898, when the work of establishing Kyoto Imperial University was settled, Kojuro NAKAGAWA resigned from his post as a counselor to the Ministry of Education and became a businessman.

sen.j: 加島銀行理事への就任を皮切りに大阪堂島米穀取引所監査役、朝日生命保険株式会社副社長に就任するなど経済人として活躍した。
sen.e: Worked as a successful business parson that started as director of Kajima Ginko (Kajima Bank) and became an inspector of Osaka Dojima Beikoku Torihikijo (Osaka Dojima Grain Exchange) and then became a vice president of Asahi Seimei Insurance Company.
sen.cmt: 大阪堂島米穀取引所：定訳不明、朝日生命保険株式会社：定訳不明
sen.e: He was successful in business, starting as the director of Kajima Ginko (Kajima Bank) and eventually becoming an inspector of Osaka Dojima Beikoku Torihikijo (Osaka Dojima Grain Exchange), after which he served as a vice president of the Asahi Seimei Insurance Company.

He was successful in business, starting as the director of Kajima Ginko (Kajima Bank) and eventually becoming an inspector of Osaka Dojima Beikoku Torihikijo (Osaka Dojima Grain Exchange), after which he served as a vice president of the Asahi Seimei Insurance Company.

sen.j: しかし、自らが創設の中心に関わった京都帝国大学が制度上旧制高等学校卒業生しか受け入れることができず、西園寺公望が提唱した「能力と意欲のある人に国として（教育の）機会を与えるべき」という教育理念からもかけ離れている実態に限界を感じ、自ら私学を興すことを思い立つ。
sen.e: But, Kyoto Imperial University accepts only students who graduated from former high school for organization issue even though he was the main person for establishment of school. He felt it was far away from Kinmochi SAIONJI's proposition 'Give the chance (education) to people who is intelligent and have high motivation' because of that reason, he decided to promote private school.

However, for organizational reasons Kyoto Imperial University accepted only students who had graduated from former high schools, even though he was the main person involved in the school's establishment; he felt it was far away from Kinmochi SAIONJI's proposition of 'giving a chance (education) to people who are intelligent and have high motivation,' and therefore he decided to promote private schooling.

However, for organizational reasons Kyoto Imperial University accepted only students who had graduated from former high schools, even though he was the main person involved in the school's establishment; he felt it was far away from Kinmochi SAIONJI's proposition of 'giving a chance (education) to people who are intelligent and have high motivation,' and therefore he decided to promote private schooling.

sen.j: 翌年、教学面での協力を京都帝国大学教授だった織田萬、井上密、岡松参太郎らから得るとともに、学校設立事務については、西田由（朝日生命株式会社 専務取締役）、橋本篤（大同生命保険株式会社 初代支配人）、山下好直（京都府議会議員）、河原林樫一郎（東洋レーヨン 常務取締役）、羽室亀太郎（京津電車 支配人）らの協力を得て、また設立賛助員として京都政財界の大物（内貴仁三郎、浜岡光哲、田中源太郎、中村栄助、雨森菊太郎、高木文平、河原林義男）の力を借り、京都法政学校設立事務所を朝日生命保険株式会社の一角に設置した。
sen.e: The next year, he got mathematical support from former professors of Kyoto Imperial University, Yorozu ODA, Hisoka INOUE, Santaro OKAMATSU. And Yui Nishida (executive director of Asahi Seimei Company), Atsuhi HASHIMOTO (the first president of Daido Seimei Insurance Company), Yoshinao YAMASHITA (member of the Kyoto metropolitan assembly), Kashiichiro KAWARABAYASHI (executive director of Toyo Rayon (Toray)), Kametaro HAMURO (general manager of Keihin Densha) had supported for management for establishment of school. And also important people of Kyoto financial affairs had assisted to establishment (Jinzamuro NAIKI, Koutetsu HAMAOKA, Gentaro TANAKA, Eisuke NAKAMURA, Kikutaro AMEMORI, Bunpei TAKAGI, Yoshio KAWARABAYASHI) All these people's help, he established the office of Kyoto Hosei School in corner of Asahi Seimei Insurance Company.
sen.cmt: 大同生命保険株式会社：http://www.daido-life.co.jp/about/company/gaiyou.html、西田由：読み不明 山下好直：読み不明、河原林樫一郎：読み不明、内貴仁三郎：読み不明
sen.e: The next year he obtained mathematical support from former professors of Kyoto Imperial University, Yorozu ODA, Hisoka INOUE, Santaro OKAMATSU, as well as Yui Nishida (executive director of the Asahi Seimei Company), Atsuhi HASHIMOTO (the first president of Daido Seimei Insurance Company), Yoshinao YAMASHITA (member of the Kyoto Metropolitan Assembly), Kashiichiro KAWARABAYASHI (executive director of Toyo Rayon (Toray)), Kametaro HAMURO (general manager of Keihin Densha) had supported in terms of management for the establishment of the school. Other important people from the realm of Kyoto financial affairs had assisted in the school's establishment, including Jinzamuro NAIKI, Koutetsu HAMAOKA, Gentaro TANAKA, Eisuke NAKAMURA, Kikutaro AMEMORI, Bunpei TAKAGI, Yoshio KAWARABAYASHI), and with the help of these people he established the office of Kyoto Hosei School in a corner of the Asahi Seimei Insurance Company.

The next year he obtained teaching support from former professors of Kyoto Imperial University, Yorozu ODA, Hisoka INOUE, Santaro OKAMATSU, as well as Yui Nishida (executive director of the Asahi Seimei Company), Atsushi HASHIMOTO (the first president of Daido Seimei Insurance Company), Yoshinao YAMASHITA (member of the Kyoto Metropolitan Assembly), Kashiichiro KAWARABAYASHI (executive director of Toyo Rayon (Toray)), Kametaro HAMURO (general manager of Keishin Densha) had supported in terms of management for the establishment of the school. Other important people from the realm of Kyoto financial affairs lent their assistance to the school's establishment, including Jinzaburo NAIKI, Koutetsu HAMAOKA, Gentaro TANAKA, Eisuke NAKAMURA, Kikutaro AMEMORI, Bunpei TAKAGI, Yoshio KAWARABAYASHI), and with the help of these people he established the office of Kyoto Hosei School in a corner of the Asahi Seimei Insurance Company.
sen.cmt: 「教学面での協力」の訳を訂正しました。（数学面ではなく）/京津=Keishin など

sen.j: 1900年5月4日、京都府知事に対し「私立京都法政学校設立認可申請書」を提出。
sen.e: In May 4, 1990, submitted 'Request for establishment of private Private Kyoto Law and Politics Technical School' to Governor ofKyoto.
sen.cmt: 私立京都法政学校設立認可申請書：定訳不明
sen.e: In May 4, 1990 he submitted 'Request for Establishment of Private Kyoto Law and Politics Technical School' to the governor of Kyoto.
In May 4, 1900 he submitted 'Request for Establishment of Private Kyoto Law and Politics Technical School' to the governor of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: スペース [I THINK THE YEAR SHOULD BE 1900.]

sen.j: 同年5月19日、晴れて設置が認可され、同6月5日に開校式典を開いている。
sen.e: Same year on May 19, fortunately establishment of school was approved, and on June 5, had a ceremony for school opening.
Fortunately the same year, on May 19, the school's establishment was approved, and on June 5 a ceremony was held to celebrate the school's opening.
Fortunately the same year, on May 19, the school's establishment was approved, and on June 5 a ceremony was held to celebrate the school's opening.

sen.j: 初代校長には、民法起草者の一人で東京帝国大学教授の富井政章が就任した。
sen.e: The first principal was the professor of Tokyo Teikoku University Masaakira TOMII who was one of the members that drafted the civil law.
The first principal was a professor from Tokyo Teikoku University, Masaakira TOMII, who had been involved in drafting the code of civil law.
The first principal was a professor from Tokyo Imperial University, Masaakira TOMII, who had been involved in drafting the code of civil law.

sen.j: 富井は1927年8月31日まで京都法政学校長、私立立命館大学長の任にあたった。
sen.e: Tomii worked as principal of Kyoto Hosei School and Ritsumeikan Private School until August 31, 1927.
Tomii worked as principal of Kyoto Hosei School and Ritsumeikan Private School until August 31, 1927.
Tomii worked as principal of Kyoto Hosei School and Ritsumeikan Private School until August 31, 1927.

sen.j: 京都法政学校の設立
sen.e: Establishment of Kyoto Hosei School
Establishment of Kyoto Hosei School
Establishment of Kyoto Hosei School

sen.j: 設立の中心を担った中川小十郎が「初めより浮華を斥け堅実を旨とした」（「序文」『立命館三十五周年記念論文集文学編）と述べているように、設立当時は満足な校地も学舎も用意する余裕はなく、上京区三本木通にあった料亭「清輝楼（旧・吉田屋）」の二階および三階部分を間借りして講義を行っていた。
sen.e: Kojuro NAKAGAWA who took the lead for establishment of school said 'from the beginning avoid pretending to be gorgeous, intend to be stable ('introduction' "35 years anniversary memorial thesis literature book"). The time school was established it was not enough to prepare for everything such as satisfactory space for school building, they rented second and third floor of 'Seikiro (former Yoshida-ya)' located in Sanbongi-dori, Kamigyo-ku for lecture.

Kojuro NAKAGAWA, who took the lead in establishing the school, said, 'From the beginning avoid pretending to be gorgeous but intend to be stable ('introduction' "35th Anniversary Memorial Thesis Literature Book"); but for the time in which the school was established it wasn't enough to prepare for everything such as a satisfactory space for school-building, so instead they rented the second and third floors of 'Seikiro (the former Yoshida-ya)' located in Sanbongi-dori, Kamigyo-ku, in order to give lectures.

Kojuro NAKAGAWA, who took the lead in establishing the school, said, 'From the beginning avoid pretending to be gorgeous but intend to be stable ('introduction' "35th Anniversary Memorial Thesis Literature Book"); but for the time in which the school was established it wasn't enough to prepare for everything such as a satisfactory space for school-building, so instead they rented the second and third floors of 'Seikiro (the former Yoshida-ya)' located in Sanbongi-dori, Kamigyo-ku, in order to give lectures.

sen.j: 社会人教育を目的に夜間学校（三年制）として設立されたため、学生には官庁職員、府立学校教諭、府の名誉職にあるものなどが多く含まれていた。
sen.e: School was established for worker's education as a night school (three years), there was the student who was the government officer, prefecture school teacher, prefecture worker who had honorable position.

The school was established for worker education as a night school (three years); there were students who served as the government officer and prefecture school teacher, while the prefecture worker was an honorary position.

The school was established for worker education as a night school (three years); there were students who served as the government officer, prefecture school teacher, or the prefectural worker in an honorary position.
sen.cmt: 「学生には官庁職員、府立学校教諭、府の名誉職にあるものなどが多く含まれていた。」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: また専任教員を雇う余裕もなく、講義のほとんどを京都帝国大学教授が担当していた。
sen.e: It was not enough budgets to hire the specialized professors, the professors of Kyoto Imperial University were teaching there.
The budget wasn't sufficient to hire the specialized professors, though the professors from Kyoto Imperial University would teach there.
The budget wasn't sufficient to hire specialized professors, so the professors from Kyoto Imperial University covered most lectures.
sen.cmt: 「ほとんどを」の意味を入れた訳に変更しました。

sen.j: その校名が示すとおり、設立当初は法学・政治学の2学科を置くのみであった。
sen.e: Shown as school name, when school was established there were only two departments which is the law department and the politics department.
Shown as the school name, when the school was established there were only two departments: Law and Politics.
Shown as the school name, when the school was established there were only two departments: Law and Politics.

sen.j: しかし開講直後に京都府に提出した「校舎敷地貸与願書」では、「将来は法政だけではなく文学、医学の二科を増設し、中学教員および医師を養成して、わが国教育の一大欠点を補充する一機関にしたい」と表明していることから、京都法政学校の校名は設立当時の一時的なものと考えられていたことが窺える。
sen.e: But the document which handed in Kyoto prefecture 'application of school building rental' said 'In the future, we plan to add two more departments which is the literature department and the medical department for making up our one of biggest issue of education in this country that training of the junior high school teacher and the doctor.

However, the document that was submitted to Kyoto Prefecture as an 'application for school building rental' said, 'In the future, we plan to add two more departments--the Literature Department and the Medical Department--in order to take up one of the biggest issues of education in this country, which is to train junior high school teachers and doctors.'

However, the document that was submitted to Kyoto Prefecture as an 'application for school building rental' said, 'In the future, we plan to add two more departments--the Literature Department and the Medical Department--in order to take up one of the biggest issues of education in this country, which is to train junior high school teachers and doctors,' which implies that "Kyoto Hosei Gakko" was regarded as tentative name.
sen.cmt: 「京都法政学校の校名は設立当時の一時的なものと考えられていたことが窺える。」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 実際、1904年には大学部に「経済科」が設置され、法政学校の域を越える体制となっており、翌年には「立命館」という新しい学校名称の命名に向けた具体的な動きも見られる。
sen.e: Actually, in 1904 'the economics department' was founded in college department which transcended Hosei School more than that. A and next year renamed 'Ritsumeikan' which looks concrete changes for new name.

In fact, in 1904 the Economics Department was founded as a college department that transcended the definition of Hosei School; accordingly, the next year it was 'Ritsumeikan,' thus signaling the search for concrete changes befitting the new name.

In fact, in 1904 the Economics Department was founded as a college department that transcended the definition of Hosei School; accordingly, the next year it was 'Ritsumeikan,' thus signaling the search for concrete changes befitting the new name.

sen.j: なお、1889年に設立された京都法学校は、実質的に京都法政学校が引き継ぐ形で吸収されており、校主の山崎恵純は引き続き京都法政学校で教鞭を取ったと記録されている。
sen.e: Also, Kyoto Hogakko (Kyoto Law School) was established in 1889 which took over the system and the assimilation of Kyoto Hosei School essentially. According to the record, the school owner Keijun YAMASAKI was kept teaching in Kyoto Hosei School.

Additionally, Kyoto Hogakko (Kyoto Law School) was established in 1889, essentially taking over the system of and assimilating Kyoto Hosei School; according to the historical record, the school owner, Keijun YAMASAKI, continued to teach at Kyoto Hosei School.

Additionally, Kyoto Hogakko (Kyoto Law School) was established in 1889, essentially taking over the system of and assimilating Kyoto Hosei School; according to the historical record, the school owner, Keijun YAMASAKI, continued to teach at Kyoto Hosei School.

sen.j: 設立以降
sen.e: After establishment of school
After the school's establishment
After the school's establishment

sen.j: 京都府に提出した「校舎敷地貸与願書」では、当時上京区土手町通丸太町通下ル駒之町にあった「旧京都府立第一高等女学校」の校舎と敷地の期限付貸与を申し出たが、「京都府立第二高等女学校」の利用が決まったためにこれを断念。
sen.e: At that time, they petitioned to rent a school building and land of 'Former Kyoto Prefectural First Women's Technical High School' which located in Dotemachi-dori Marutamachi-dori sagaru Komanocho, Kamigyo-ku, by 'Application of school renting' which handed in to Kyoto prefecture, but they abandoned the application because 'Former Kyoto Prefectural Second Women's Technical High School' got approved for rent.
sen.cmt: 旧京都府立第一高等女学校：定訳不明、
sen.e: At that time they petitioned to rent a school building and land of 'the former Kyoto Prefectural First Women's Technical High School,' located in Dotemachi-dori Marutamachi-dori sagaru Komanocho, Kamigyo-ku, by means of the 'application for school rental' submitted to Kyoto Prefecture; however, they abandoned the application because the former Kyoto Prefectural Second Women's Technical High School had been approved for rent.

At that time they petitioned to rent a school building and land of 'the former Kyoto Prefectural First Women's Technical High School,' located in Dotemachi-dori Marutamachi-dori sagaru Komanocho, Kamigyo-ku, by means of the 'application for school rental' submitted to Kyoto Prefecture; however, they abandoned the application because the former Kyoto Prefectural Second Women's Technical High School had been approved for rent.

sen.j: そこで1901年12月、西園寺公望の実弟で第15代住友家当主・住友公純から1,500円の寄付を得るなどして上京区広小路通 (京都市)河原町（中御霊町410番地）に校地と学舎を確保し移転した。
sen.e: In December 1901, 15th owner of Sumitomo, Kimisuimi SUMITOMO who is the real brother of Kinmochi SAIONJI donated 1,500 yen and reserved land and school building which located in Hirokoji-dori Kawaramachi, Kamigyo-ku, (410 Nakagoryocho) and moved there.

In December 1901, the fifteenth owner of Sumitomo, Kimisuimi SUMITOMO, who was the real brother of Kinmochi SAIONJI, donated 1,500 yen, reserved land and a school building located in Hirokoji-dori Kawaramachi, Kamigyo-ku, (410 Nakagoryocho) and moved there.

In December 1901, the fifteenth owner of Sumitomo, Kimisumi SUMITOMO, who was the real brother of Kinmochi SAIONJI, donated 1,500 yen, reserved land and a school building located in Hirokoji-dori Kawaramachi, Kamigyo-ku, (410 Nakagoryocho), Kyoto-City, and moved there.
sen.cmt: 公純=Kimisumiスペル/京都市を入れました。

sen.j: この広小路校地は1981年に衣笠キャンパス（北区等持院北町）に移転するまでの約80年間、立命館大学の本部キャンパスとして機能した。
sen.e: This Koshojikochi was the campus of Ritumeikan University for about 80 years until moving to Kinugasa Campus (Tojiinkitamachi, Kita-ku) in 1981.
This Koshojikochi was the campus of Ritsumeikan University for about 80 years until the relocation to Kinugasa Campus (Tojiinkitamachi, Kita-ku) in 1981.
This school site at Hirokoji served as the campus of Ritsumeikan University for about 80 years until the relocation to the Kinugasa Campus (Tojiinkitamachi, Kita-ku) in 1981.
sen.cmt: 広小路校地の訳を修正しました。時制

sen.j: 1903年に専門学校令により「私立京都法政専門学校」に組織変更。
sen.e: In 1903, changed the organization to 'Shiritsu Kyoto Hosei Senmon Gakko (Private Kyoto Law and Politics Technical School)' by Acts of Colleges.
sen.cmt: 専門学校令：http://www.cis.doshisha.ac.jp/kkitao/doshisha/chronology.htm, 私立京都法政専門学校：定訳不明
sen.e: In 1903, the organization was changed to 'Shiritsu Kyoto Hosei Senmon Gakko (Private Kyoto Law and Politics Technical School)' in compliance with the Acts of Colleges.
In 1903, the organization was changed to 'Shiritsu Kyoto Hosei Senmon Gakko (Private Kyoto Law and Politics Technical School)' in compliance with the Acts of Colleges.

sen.j: 翌1904年、「私立京都法政大学」に改称、大学部（法律学科、経済学科、予科）、専門学部（法律科、行政科、経済科、高等研究科）を設置。
sen.e: Next year in 1904, renamed 'Kyoto Hosei Private University' established University Department (the department of law, the department of public administration, the department of economics, the department of high research)
The next year (1904) it was renamed 'Kyoto Hosei Private University' and established the university departments of Law, Public Administration, Economics and High Research.

The next year (1904) it was renamed 'Kyoto Hosei Private University' and established the university departments (Law, Economics and the preparatory course) and specialized studies (Law, Public Administration, Economics and High Research).
sen.cmt: 「（法律学科、経済学科、予科）、専門学部」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 1905年には、西園寺公望が明治2年に京都御所内の私邸に設置した「私塾立命館」の名称の継承を願い出てこれを許可され、1913年「財団法人立命館」を設立すると共に、校名を「私立立命館大学」と改称した。
sen.e: In 1905, they got approved succeeding name from 'Shijuku Ritsumeikan' which established by Kinmochi SAIONJI in his private palace in Kyoto Imperial Palace in 1869, then established 'Ritsumeikan Foundation' and renamed school to ""Private Ritsumeikan University'.

In 1905 the school received approval to succeed in name from 'Shijuku Ritsumeikan,' which had been established by Kinmochi SAIONJI in his private place in Kyoto Imperial Palace in 1869, then established the 'Ritsumeikan Foundation' and renamed the school as the 'Private Ritsumeikan University.'

In 1905 the school received approval to succeed in name from 'Shijuku Ritsumeikan,' which had been established by Kinmochi SAIONJI in his private space at the Kyoto Imperial Palace in 1869, and in 1913 established the 'Ritsumeikan Foundation' and renamed it as the 'Private Ritsumeikan University.'

sen.j: 財団法人立命館専務理事には、西園寺公望の実弟で、京都法政学校創設以来学園運営に尽力した末弘威麿が就任。
sen.e: Takemaro SUEHIRO assumed the executive board of director who is a real brother of Kinmochi SAIONJI and he made effort to managing school since Kyoto Hosei School was established.

Takemaro SUEHIRO assumed a place of executive on the Board of Directors as a real brother of Kinmochi SAIONJI, since he had endeavored to manage the school since the Kyoto Hosei School was established.

Takemaro SUEHIRO assumed a place of executive on the Board of Directors as a real brother of Kinmochi SAIONJI, since he had endeavored to manage the school since the Kyoto Hosei School was established.

sen.j: 末弘は中川と、財団法人立命館初代理事および私立立命館大学設立者の座を共有した。
sen.e: SUEHIRO and NAKAGAWA shared the position of the first board of director of Ritsumeikan Foundation and the founder of Private Ristumeikan University.
SUEHIRO and NAKAGAWA shared the position on the first Board of Directors of the Ritsumeikan Foundation and as founders of the Private Ristumeikan University.
SUEHIRO and NAKAGAWA shared the position on the first Board of Directors of the Ritsumeikan Foundation and as founders of the Private Ristumeikan University.

sen.j: 現在、京都法政学校が仮学舎とした「清輝楼」の跡地には、「立命館草創の地」を示す記念碑が建っている。
sen.e: Now, there is a monument which is showed 'starting place of Ritsumeikan' at 'Seikiro" used to be at, which Kyoto Hosei school used to use as temporary school.
Today there is a monument inscribed as the 'starting place of Ritsumeikan' on the site of the former 'Seikiro," which Kyoto Hosei school once used as a temporary school.
Today there is a monument inscribed as the 'starting place of Ritsumeikan' on the site of the former 'Seikiro," which Kyoto Hosei school once used as a temporary school.

sen.j: また、1901（明治34）年から1981（昭和56）年まで学校法人本部のあった「広小路学舎」跡地（旧中川会館付近）にも「立命館大学発祥の地」記念碑が建てられている。
sen.e: Also there is the monument of 'Beginning of the place of Ritsumeikan University' it was built at the place for the main office of educational foundation from 1901 to 1981, and 'Hirokoji gakusha' used be (Former Nakagawa Kaikan (Nakagawa Hall)).

There is also a monument inscribed 'Beginning of the place of Ritsumeikan University,' which was built at the site of the main office of the educational foundation from 1901 to 1981, and is where 'Hirokoji gakusha' once was (the former Nakagawa Kaikan (Nakagawa Hall).

There is also a monument inscribed 'Beginning of the place of Ritsumeikan University,' which was built at the site of the main office of the educational foundation from 1901 to 1981, and is where 'Hirokoji gakusha' once was (the former Nakagawa Kaikan (Nakagawa Hall).

sen.j: 創立の主意
sen.e: The main idea of establishment
The concept of establishment
The concept of establishment

sen.j: 政府は曩に一の帝国大学を京都に新設し、天下学問の中心を東西二都に置くの制を採れり、蓋し東西二大学の競争をして学問進歩の動機たらしめんとするに在るべし、而して東京には帝国大学の外各種の官私学校ありて各般学生の志望に充つることを得、青年の志を立つる者此に集合し自ら既に天下学問の中心たり、然るに京都に在りては帝国大学新たに設置せられ関西の学術大に振るわんとし青年の志を有して京都に集まり来るもの頗る多きも、大学の門戸は未だ高等学校卒業生以外の志望者を迎ふるに至らず、大学以外に在りて高等の学術を修めんとするも其機関あることなし、是れ頗る恨事なり、爰に於てか有志の者相図り京都法政学校を新設し、講義を京都帝国大学教授及其他博学知名の諸氏に嘱託し、政治法律経済に関する高等の学術を広く社会に紹介するの一機関たらしめんとす、是れ蓋し、一は政府か学問の中心を東西の二都に置かんとするの趣意に賛同の意を表し、又一は帝国大学か広く門戸を開放して高等学校卒業生以外の志望者を迎ふる能はさるの欠点を補はんとするの微意に出つるものなり （「立命館大学沿革略」『立命館学報』二 一九一五・大正4年3月）
sen.e: The government established one of Teikoku University in Kyoto, and decided to have two universities in east and west as the center of the best education, and the two universities should compete each other as motivation of progress of education, and then Teikoku University was accepted applicants from each specialized military schools and the students who has youthful resolution gathered in Tokyo which is the center of education, however, there was many good students who has youthful resolution was gathered to Teikoku University that was newly established in Kyoto, but the university couldn't accepts the applicants who was not graduated from high school, but there was no school to study highly education without the university, that was the most concerned problem, so the volunteers who has same mind gathered and newly established the Kyoto Hosei School, and entrusted the lectures to the professors of Kyoto Imperial University and other well known professors, the institution must be introduced the high education of the political law economics to society, certainly, one reason is showing the approval of establishment of the government or education in two places east and west, and another reason is the Teikoku University widely opened to applicants who doesn't graduate from high school which hopefully covers the problem. ('Ritsumeikan University brief history' "Ritsumeikan Gakuho" March, 1915)

The government established one campus of Teikoku University in Kyoto. It had been decided that there would be two universities in the east and west as the center of the best education, and that the two universities would compete with each other as motivation for the progress of education, whereupon Teikoku University began accepting applicants from each specialized military school; thus the students who had youthful resolution gathered in Tokyo, which is the center of education. However, there were many good students who had youthful resolution gathered at Teikoku University, which was newly established in Kyoto, but the university couldn't accepts the applicants who was not graduated from high school, but there was no school to study high education without status as a university, which was the problem of greatest concern, so volunteers who were of the same mind gathered and established the Kyoto Hosei School, entrusting the lectures to the professors of Kyoto Imperial University and other well-known teachers; thus the institution could introduce the high education of politics, law and economics to society. Certainly, a reason for that was to demonstrate the government's approval for the establishment of education in two places (east and west), and another reason is that Teikoku University widely opened to applicants who had not graduated from high school, whereby it was hoped the problem would be solved ('A Brief History of Ritsumeikan University,' "Ritsumeikan Gakuho," March 1915).

The government established one campus of Teikoku (Imperial) University in Kyoto. It had been decided that there would be two universities (in the east and west, respectively) as the center of the best education, and that the two universities would compete with each other as motivation for progress in education; and in Tokyo, several public and private schools as well as Teikoku （Imperial) University already began accepting various applicants; thus the students who had youthful resolution gathered, which is the center of education. However, there were many good, enthusiastic young students gathered at Teikoku (Imperial) University, which was newly established in Kyoto, but the university couldn't accept the applicants who had not graduated from high school, so there was no school to study high education without status as a university, which was the problem of greatest concern, so volunteers who were of the same mind gathered and established the Kyoto Hosei School, entrusting the lectures to the professors of Kyoto Imperial University and other well-known teachers; thus the institution could provide higher education in politics, law and economics to society. Certainly, a reason for that was to demonstrate the government's approval concerning the establishment of education in two places (east and west), and another reason was to make up for the flaw in the educational system whereby Teikoku (Imperial) University was not widely open to applicants who had not graduated from high school ('A Brief History of Ritsumeikan University,' "Ritsumeikan Gakuho," March 1915).
sen.cmt: 「而して東京には帝国大学の外各種の官私学校ありて各般学生の志望に充つることを得、」/「帝国大学か広く門戸を開放して高等学校卒業生以外の志望者を迎ふる能はさるの欠点を補はんとするの微意に出つるものなり」の部分の訳を原文に合わせて訂正しました。

sen.j: 第一期入学生
sen.e: The first new students
The first new students

sen.j: 第一期生について
sen.e: About the first students
About the first students
About the first students

sen.j: 1900（明治33）年の開学時、京都法政学校への志願者数は360名だった。
sen.e: In 1900, when school was opened, it was 360 applicants who applied to Kyoto Hosei School.
In 1900, when the school was opened, 360 applicants had applied for admission to Kyoto Hosei School.
In 1900, when the school was opened, 360 applicants had applied for admission to Kyoto Hosei School.

sen.j: このうち305名（法律科：225名、政治科：80名）を第一期生として受け入れたが、入学から三年後、実際に卒業できたのは57名（法律科：47名、政治科：10名）のみであった。
sen.e: In 305 students (Department of Law 225, Department of Politics 80) were accepted to enter the school as the first students, but after three years from entered the school, actually it was 57 students who graduated from school. (Department of Law 47, Department of Politics 10)

Of those applicants, 305 (Department of Law 225, Department of Politics 80) were accepted to enter the school as the first students, but after three years from entering the school there were just 57 graduates (Department of Law 47, Department of Politics 10).

Of those applicants, 305 (Department of Law 225, Department of Politics 80) were accepted to enter the school as the first students, but after three years from entering the school there were just 57 graduates (Department of Law 47, Department of Politics 10).

sen.j: 卒業生57名のうち20歳から25歳が過半数。
sen.e: Majority of the students who graduated was age 20 to 25 years old.
Nearly half of the graduating students were in the range of 20 to 25 years old.
Of the 57 graduating students, more than half were aged 20 to 25.
sen.cmt: チェック後の翻訳の間違い

sen.j: 20歳未満は約2割。
sen.e: 20% was under 20 years old.
Twenty percent were under 20 years of age.
Twenty percent were under 20 years of age.

sen.j: 26歳以上が3割弱。
sen.e: Nearly 30% of students were older than 26 years old.
Nearly 30% of the students were older than 26 years.
Nearly 30% of the students were older than 26 years.

sen.j: 最年長者は41歳だったと記録されている。
sen.e: According to the record, the oldest graduated student was 41 years old.
According to the record, the oldest graduating student was 41 years old.
According to the record, the oldest graduating student was 41 years old.

sen.j: 第一期生卒業式は1903（明治36）年7月12日に講堂にて執り行われ、来賓として京都帝国大学教授・助教授のほか、第三高等学校 (旧制)長、京都地方裁判所所長、京都弁護士会会長代表、京都府議会副議長、地元選出代議士、京都府庁参事官、視学官など多数が参加し、一私学としてはかなり盛大なものとなった。
sen.e: The first students graduation ceremony was held in July 12, 1903 at the hall, and invited as guest who were the professor and assistant professor of Teikoku University, (former) principal of Third High School, the chief of the Kyoto District Court, The representative of Kyoto Bar Association, the Vice President of Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, the local politcian, the counselor of Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, and executive officier of education, it was magnificent ceremony as a private school.
sen.cmt: 第三高等学校：定訳不明、京都弁護士会：http://www.kyotoben.or.jp/ 京都府庁参事官：定訳不明
sen.e: The first graduation ceremony was held on July 12, 1903 at the hall, and among the guests were the professor and assistant professor of Teikoku University, the (former) principal of Third High School, the chief of the Kyoto District Court, a representative from the Kyoto Bar Association, the vice president of the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, a local politician, a counselor of the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, and an executive officer in charge of education, all of whom contributed to the magnificent ceremony for this private school.

The first graduation ceremony was held at the hall on July 12, 1903, and among the guests were the professor and assistant professor of Kyoto Imperial University, the (former) principal of Third High School, the chief of the Kyoto District Court, a representative from the Kyoto Bar Association, the vice president of the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, a local politician, a counselor of the Kyoto Prefectural Assembly, and an executive officer in charge of education, all of whom contributed to the magnificent ceremony for this private school.
sen.cmt: 京都帝国大学の訳を訂正しました。

sen.j: 卒業式当日、東京都にあって入洛できない校長の富井政章に代わり、教頭の井上密が卒業証書の授与を行い、来賓代表の木下廣次（京都帝国大学総長）が祝辞を述べた。
sen.e: The day of the graduation, The vice principal, Mitsu INOUE handed out diplomas instead of the principal, Masaaki TOMII couldn't come to Kyoto because he was in Tokyo, and Hiroji KINOSHITA (president of Kyoto Imperial University) had congratulatory speeches as a representative of the guest.

On the day of the graduation the vice principal, Mitsu INOUE, handed out diplomas instead of the principal, Masaaki TOMII who couldn't come to Kyoto because he was in Tokyo, and Hiroji KINOSHITA (president of Kyoto Imperial University) gave a congratulatory speech as a representative of the guests in attendance.

On the day of the graduation the vice principal, Hisoka INOUE, handed out diplomas instead of the principal, Masaaki TOMII who couldn't come to Kyoto because he was in Tokyo, and Hiroji KINOSHITA (the president of Kyoto Imperial University) gave a congratulatory speech as a representative of the guests in attendance.

sen.j: 翌日には、浅田賢介教授、井上密教授、岡松参太郎教授、織田萬教授、島文次郎教授、田島錦治教授、仁井田益太郎教授らが参加して謝恩会が開催され、知恩院桜門前で卒業記念撮影会開かれた。
sen.e: The next day the graduation party was held with Professor Kensuke ASADA, Professor Hisoka INOUE, Professor Santaro OKAMATSU, Professor Mitsuru ODA, Professor Bunjiro SHIMA, Professor Kinji TAJIMA, and Professor Masutaro NIIDA, and they took graduation memorial pictures in front of Choin-in Temple Sakura-mon (Sakura Gate).

The next day there was a graduation party with professors Kensuke ASADA, Hisoka INOUE, Santaro OKAMATSU, Mitsuru ODA, Bunjiro SHIMA, Kinji TAJIMA and Masutaro NIIDA, and they took graduation memorial pictures in front of Choin-in Temple Sakura-mon (Sakura Gate).

The next day there was a graduation party with professors Kensuke ASADA, Hisoka INOUE, Santaro OKAMATSU, Mitsuru ODA, Bunjiro SHIMA, Kinji TAJIMA and Masutaro NIIDA, and commemorative graduation pictures were taken in front of Chion-in Temple Sakura-mon (Sakura Gate).
sen.cmt: 知恩院のスペルを修正しました。
